title: Jack Teixeira’s Fellow Gamers Say He Wanted Them to Understand War
description: They liked online war games. But Airman Jack Teixeira wanted them to learn about real war. So, they say, he began showing them classified documents.

title: Ex-C.I.A. Psychologist Re-enacts Interrogations for Guantánamo Court
description: Lawyers for a Saudi prisoner had the psychologist show some of his practices in an effort to exclude evidence as derived from torture.

title: Iran and Nicaragua Discussed Military Cooperation, Leaked Report Says
description: The two countries had found common ground in opposing “perceived U.S. efforts to expand influence in Latin America,” according to an intelligence update based on C.I.A. intercepts.

title: Your Friday Briefing: An Arrest in the Documents Leak
description: Also, the WTA will return to China.

title: Live Updates: Air National Guardsman Arrested as F.B.I. Searches His Home
description: Federal officials are investigating leaks of classified U.S. intelligence revealing government secrets about the Ukraine war. Attorney General Merrick Garland announced the airman’s arrest in connection with the unauthorized removal and transmission of classified information.

title: Biden Thanks Ireland for Backing Ukraine
description: “I’m at home,” the president told the Irish Parliament to thunderous applause. “I only wish I could stay longer.”

title: After Shunning Assad for Years, the Arab World Is Returning Him to the Fold
description: President Bashar al-Assad of Syria was isolated for years after brutally crushing his country’s Arab Spring uprising. But in most Arab capitals today, the only question is how — not whether — they should deal with him again.

title: Biden Plans an Electric Vehicle Revolution. Now, the Hard Part.
description: The administration’s push to supercharge E.V. sales must now surmount resistance from manufacturers and consumers as well as likely legal challenges.

title: As World Warms, Droughts Come On Faster, Study Finds
description: When rains fail unexpectedly, higher temperatures can more rapidly parch the ground, to devastating effect.

title: Northern Ireland Shows How Hard It Is to End a Conflict
description: Northern Ireland had tremendous economic, political, and geographic advantages — but ending the Troubles still proved extremely difficult.

title: Once Shocking, U.S. Spying on Its Allies Draws a Global Shrug
description: Compared with revelations in 2013 of mass surveillance by the National Security Agency, intelligence reports in a trove of recently leaked documents have resulted in limited outrage abroad.

title: Here’s what we know about the leader of the online group where secret documents were leaked.
description: Federal investigators are searching for the person who shared classified documents that revealed government secrets about the Ukraine war.

title: The U.S. investigation into the leaked Pentagon documents is ‘getting close’ to finding answers, Biden says.
Leader of Online Group Where Secret Documents Leaked Is Air National Guardsman
description: Federal investigators are searching for the person who shared top secret documents that revealed government secrets about the Ukraine war.

title: Seeking Visibility, Pope’s Commission on Sex Abuse Gets a New Home
description: In moving from cramped offices to a palazzo, the organization is aiming for more visibility, and to be better able to welcome victims.

title: Biden will thank the Irish people for their support of Ukraine.
Ukraine presses allies for more aid before an expected spring counteroffensive.
2 Arrested in Hong Kong After Dousing Police With Water Guns
description: Songkran, a traditional Thai festival, often involves splashing and squirting. But the continuing crackdowns on all forms of dissent in Hong Kong made things different this year.

title: Ukraine Pushes Allies for More Aid Before Expected Counteroffensive
description: The country is also pressuring nations that have lingered on the periphery of the conflict to send help, not limiting the campaign to reliable partners. Here is what we’re covering.

title: Inside Bakhmut: Pushed into a corner, the Ukrainian military is determined to hold out.
Protests Persist in France as Macron’s Pension Law Nears Last Hurdle
description: A constitutional ruling expected on Friday may be the final legal obstacle for President Emmanuel Macron’s push to increase the retirement age. But the plan hasn’t become any more popular.

title: Belarus Extradites Russian Man Convicted After His Daughter Drew Antiwar Picture, State Media Reports
description: Aleksei Moskalyov, a single father, escaped house arrest in Russia after he was charged with “discrediting” the Russian Army over the war in Ukraine.

title: How to See a Black Hole More Clearly
description: Astronomers recently used artificial intelligence to fine-tune a famous image of a whole lot of nothing.

title: Inflation Keeps Cooling
description: Prices aren’t climbing as quickly as they once were.

title: People who wouldn’t be allowed anywhere near the battlefield in a U.S.-led war are active on the Ukrainian front.
description: People who would not be allowed anywhere near the battlefield in a U.S.-led war are active on the Ukrainian front, with ready access to American weapons.

title: Jailed Russian Opposition Leader Aleksei Navalny’s Suffering From Acute Stomach Pain
description: Prison staff were forced to call an ambulance for Aleksei A. Navalny, the jailed Russian opposition leader, last week, his spokeswoman said.

title: Jung Chae-yull, South Korean Actress, Is Found Dead at 26
description: Though the cause of the unexpected death of Jung Chae-yull was not disclosed, it has renewed concerns about mental health in the country’s highly competitive entertainment industry.

title: ‘Glory to Putin’: How Pro-Russian Narratives Spread in Africa
description: Pro-Russian content presenting a distorted version of the war in Ukraine and promoting Russia’s interests in Africa is gaining an audience on the continent.

title: How Janelle Jones’s Story About Black Women and the Economy Caught On
description: The first Black woman to serve as chief economist at the Labor Department advanced the idea that lifting up people on the margins helps everyone else, too.

title: Poland’s prime minister says Ukraine needs South Korean artillery shells.
Lonely Cry for Action as China Locks Up Japanese Citizens on Spy Charges
description: Hideji Suzuki says Japan failed him during his six years in a Chinese prison. China’s recent arrest of a Japanese citizen is again testing Tokyo’s resolve.

title: North Korea Launches Missile as Japan Issues Brief Evacuation Alarm
description: Kim Jong-un has staged 12 rounds of missile tests since January, including the firing of a ballistic missile on ​Thursday.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The battle for Bakhmut.

title: New Leaked Documents Show Broad Infighting Among Russian Officials
description: The additional documents also suggest the breach of American intelligence agencies could contain far more material than previously believed.

title: Leaked Document Says Russia’s Ally Serbia Is Sending Arms to Ukraine
description: The revelation could create tensions between the Kremlin and the Balkan nation.
